subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: computer-typed Quickscript manual and FAQ
msgSnippet: Please no html-email with ascii-qs! HTML has no busness in email, no matter what Yahoo, MSN or the other culprits think! /BP
messageBody:
Please no html-email with ascii-qs!
HTML has no busness in email, no matter what
Yahoo, MSN or the other culprits think!

/BP

paul vandenbrink skrev:
> Hi Robert
> In response to question 3.
> I know the ShawAlphabet Forum has been using the improved Yahoo Editor
> (Beta Version) to write Shaw Letters by turning on the Shaw Sans 2 font inside the message. If there is an accessible Quickscript font on both the writer's and the reader's that trick should also work for Quickscript messages through this Forum.
> Regards, Paul V.
>
> --- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "conseil_it" <willitheowl@...> wrote:
> I have a couple questions which might be answered in the message archive already, but I couldn't find the answers. If you have answers for me, I'd be glad to put them together as an FAQ to publish on the group page.
>> 1. is thee a computer-typed (OCR'd) version of the original Quickscript manual? I mean something that's easier to read than the scanned typewriter paper.
>> (If there isn't and somebody would OCR it, I'd be glad to help edit it to a nice HTML and PDF version.)
>>
>> 2. the manual offers a short word-list to start learning writing and instructs the reader to make up his own word list as they go. Now, I am German and I don't know the pronunciation of many words (and others I pronounce wrong). I am planning to learn Quickscript and learn some good acceptable English pronunciation on the way. (Don't mind which one.) Are there any word lists for this?
>> I think Quickscript is great for foreigners to learn English! So it would be good to have some material.
>>
>> 3. is it possible to write in this forum in Quickscript? if yes, how? if no, what would be necessary to do it?
>
>
>
>
